      • selectAll

        public List<Upgrade> selectAll()
        Selects all the upgrades available in the database.
        Returns:
        List of all the upgrades in the database.

      • insert

        public boolean insert(Upgrade upgrade)
        Inserts a new upgrade in the database. An update is tried first, in case there is already an upgrade for a version. This is done this way because upgrades can only be from one version to the next, and we will always force people to update to the next version. Let's say there is an upgrade for MySQL from 5.5.15 to 5.5.17, and an upgrade from 5.5.17 to 5.5.30. The usual flow will be to upgrade to 5.5.17 and 5.5.30 later on. But we might provide a script to upgrade from 5.5.15 to 5.5.30. Then the owner will have to upgrade to 5.5.30.
        Parameters:
        upgrade - upgrade object
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful, false otherwise.

      • delete

        public boolean delete(Upgrade upgrade)
        Deletes an upgrade from the table of upgrades.
        Parameters:
        upgrade - upgrade to delete
        Returns:
        true if it was deleted, false otherwise
